Sequence Information.Peptide Name: cd2 (cyclic dimeric KR-12, synthetic AMPs, UCBB1)

Literature.Author: Gunasekera S, Muhammad T, Strömstedt AA, Rosengren KJ, Göransson U.2020
Literature.Title: Backbone Cyclization and Dimerization of LL-37-Derived Peptides Enhance Antimicrobial Activity and Proteolytic Stability.

Sequence Information.Comments: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (53.57%) toCaLLK: 14%, R: 21%, I: 14%.Activity:  active against E. coli (MIC 5 uM), P. aeruginosa (MIC 10 uM), S. aureus (MIC 10 uM), and C. albicans (MIC 5 uM). Warning: Non-standard assay.Peptide stability: ~ 50% remaining in 25% serum after 220 min (slightly less stable than cd4).
